page.title: 07A RIVER SEVERN LOCK
page.content: The{River Severn}runs North South though this area. At{Grimley}there is a{weir}and a{lock.}Because boats cannot go through the weir they use the{lock.}There is a{lock keeper}who works about 14 hours a day, from 8.00a.m to about 11p.m. He has been in charge of the{lock}for 21 years and he enjoys his work. The{lock}is now mechanised, it runs by hydraulics, although at one time it was worked by hand.About 8,500 boats go through the lock each month, mostly{holiday {traffic}so the lock is busiest in the Summer.The biggest boats are{steamers and the smallest{narrow boats.}Most of the narrow boats are made into holiday boats and colourfully decorated. {School children,youth organisations and{adults}are welcome to see how the lock works which is especially worthwhile when boats travel through.
